alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Hempstead; Lafayette; Miller; Nevada; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 5:19AM CDT until June 18 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Hempstead County in southwestern Arkansas... Northeastern Miller County in southwestern Arkansas... Eastern Lafayette County in southwestern Arkansas... Northwestern Union County in south central Arkansas... Nevada County in southwestern Arkansas... Columbia County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 519 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fulton to near Lewisville to near Smithland to near Taylor, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Magnolia, Hope, Smackover, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, McNeil, Taylor, Emmet, Emerson, Buckner, Perrytown, Rosston, Fulton, Willisville, Bodcaw, Bluff City, Smithland, Village and Lisbon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
